thread.title: Nelson Agholor leaves Eagles' game vs. New Orleans Saints with ankle injury
thread.title_full: Nelson Agholor leaves Eagles' game vs. New Orleans Saints with ankle injury

author: Eliot Shorr-Parks | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Nelson Agholor leaves Eagles' game vs. New Orleans Saints with ankle injury
text:
Comments 
PHILADELPHIA -- The Eagles ' offense is struggling and they are now down one of their starting wide receivers. 
Rookie wide receiver Nelson Agholor left the Eagles' game Sunday at Lincoln Financial Field with a left ankle injury, and in his place the team went to veteran Miles Austin. 
RELATED : WATCH: Josh Huff flips into end zone for Eagles touchdown vs. New Orleans Saints 
The team announced his return right before the half as questionable. 
The injury happened midway through the second quarter on a fourth-down attempt. It isn't clear what happened to Agholor, but he was helped off the field with a pretty severe limp. 
Agholor was looked at by trainers on the sideline before heading into the locker room right before the second half. 
The score was 7-7 when Agholor left the game. 
More details to come as they emerge.
